The Last of Us 2 represents how games sh: Waited 7 years for this game\, thought there was no way ND could make a bad sequel. Holy cow was I wrong. Game starts out pretty solid\, iffy on Joel dying in the first roughly two hours\, but whatever. Then we get to play as Abby... I have never cared about any character or subplots less than her’s. We don’t care about her and Owen. We don’t care about the crammed-in war against the Seraphites. We don’t care about any of that. ND somehow found a way to water down the specialness of their own main character in their own game. The whole “two sides of the same coin” gimmick just feels tacky and subtle as a sledgehammer. Ellie collects trading cards\, Abby collects coins. Ellie couldn’t swim\, Abby can’t be up high in the air. Mel was pregnant\, so was Dina. You can’t make this stuff up\, they really thought they were onto something with this. And don’t give me any of that anti lgbt or transphobic stuff\, Abby being masculine has nothing to do with my critique or mostly anyone’s. Makes the sex scene a little off-putting (yeah you get a good look at her naked in the game) but it’s not a valid reason to dislike her. Her inclusion\, body type and looks aside\, is still the main thing that ruins this game. It’s almost as if ND gave us Ellie to focus on and care about and gave us Abby almost like how your mom made you take your younger sibling with you to places as a kid; you’re still having some fun\, but man did they REALLY have to come too?In conclusion if you’ve read this far- game was good until they shoehorned Abby in there and expected us to like her. Could’ve been a great game but ND dropped the ball.… Expand
